title: MS AccessMinute()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessMinute()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the minute part of a specified time:
SELECT 
  Minute(#14:48:23#);

Definition and Usage
The Minute() function returns the minute part of a time/datetime.
This function returns an integer between 0 and 59.
Syntax
Minute(
time
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
time
Required. A numeric or string expression that can represent a valid 
    time/datetime
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return the minute part of the current time:
SELECT 
  Minute(Now());

Example
Return the minute part of a specified datetime:
SELECT 
  Minute(#24/10/2016 11:18:34 PM#);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessMinute()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessMinute()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessMinute()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
